Publications

2025

Robust Full-Body 3D Human Pose Estimation
Rodéo Oswald Y. TOHA
Master's Thesis, African Institute of Mathematical Sciences (AIMS)

Developed a composition of experts framework combining SMPLest-X, WiLoR, and EMOCA for parameter-level fusion, achieving real-time full-body reconstruction with superior hand and face details compared to FrankMocap baseline.

2023

Detection and Classification of Certain Diseases Affecting Vegetable Crops Using Informed Convolutional Neural Networks: Case of Tomato
Rodéo Oswald Y. TOHA
Engineering Thesis, National School of Mathematical and Modeling Engineering, Benin

Proposed a novel method for initializing convolutional filters based on phytopathology expertise. Conducted extensive study of deep CNNs and evaluated neural network interpretability and fidelity for agricultural disease detection.

Modeling Rainfall Using Recurrent Neural Networks in the Ouémé Basin at Savè
Rodéo Oswald Y. TOHA
Supervised Project, National School of Mathematical and Modeling Engineering, Benin

Developed deep RNN models for rainfall prediction with focus on neural network interpretability and uncertainty quantification.

Papers in preparation and under review will be added here. PDF links and code repositories will be made available upon publication.
